channel.title: Spy Cameras on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Spy Cameras on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: The Taboola of the 1930s
item.description: Today in Tedium: When I see people complaining about the images and links shared through the “content discovery” platform Taboola and its cousin Outbrain—something I admittedly have been known to do—I inevitably find myself drawn to the “taboo” part of the Israeli company’s name. Because, if you think about it, it’s a really good descriptor of the images you see adding noise to nearly every large site on the internet. They show ways of life and images you wish didn’t exist—images of stuff that shouldn’t exist, if there was a God.
